One of the challenges that most NGOs in Africa face when extending support to vulnerable communities is the lack of reliable accountability systems. Many NGOs rely on donor funding to support their operations, and donors often require NGOs to demonstrate that they are using funds efficiently and effectively. However, in many cases, NGOs lack the systems and processes to track and report on their activities in a transparent and accountable manner. This can make it difficult for NGOs to demonstrate their impact and can lead to a lack of trust from donors and the communities they serve.

Without reliable accountability systems, it can be difficult for NGOs to ensure that the aid they provide is reaching the intended recipients and making a positive impact on their lives. It can also make it difficult for NGOs to identify and address any challenges or issues that arise during the aid distribution process. As a result, the effectiveness of the aid provided by NGOs in Africa may be limited.
